lead_paragraph: Jay Feaster resigned as general manager of the Tampa Bay Lightning, four years after the team won the franchise’s only Stanley Cup. The Lightning won two Southeastern Division titles and made the playoffs four times in Feaster’s five full seasons as general manager. But Tampa Bay finished with the league’s worst record this past season, and Feaster’s role diminished after an ownership change.
